PyFoam.LogAnalysis.RegExpLineAnalyzer module¶

Analyzes lines with regular expressions

class PyFoam.LogAnalysis.RegExpLineAnalyzer.RegExpLineAnalyzer(name, exp, idNr=None, titles=[], doTimelines=False, doFiles=True, accumulation=None, progressTemplate=None, singleFile=False, startTime=None, endTime=None)[source]¶

Bases: PyFoam.LogAnalysis.GeneralLineAnalyzer.GeneralLineAnalyzer

Parses lines for an arbitrary regular expression

Only one data-set is stored per time-step

One pattern group of the RegExp can be used as a unique identifier, so that more than one data-sets can be stored per time-step

The string %f% in the regular expression is replaced with the regular expression for a floating point number

__init__(name, exp, idNr=None, titles=[], doTimelines=False, doFiles=True, accumulation=None, progressTemplate=None, singleFile=False, startTime=None, endTime=None)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • name – name of the expression (needed for output
  • exp – the regular expression, %f% will be replaced with the

regular expression for a float :param idNr: number of the pattern group that is used as an identifier :param titles: titles of the columns :param accumulation: How multiple values should be accumulated
